member.name: T:Autofac.Configuration.AssemblyNameConverter
member.summary: Type converter used for converting assembly name strings to assembly and back.

remarks.para: This type is used in configuration settings where an assembly name is provided and needs to be handled on the back end as a strongly-typed, loaded assembly rather than a string.

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.AssemblyNameConverter.ConvertFrom(System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext,System.Globalization.CultureInfo,System.Object)
member.summary: Converts an assembly name into an assembly.
member.param: The configuration context.
The configuration culture.
The assembly name to parse.
member.returns: If is , empty, or whitespace this conversion will return . Otherwise, the assembly specified by the will be loaded and returned.

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.AssemblyNameConverter.ConvertTo(System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext,System.Globalization.CultureInfo,System.Object,System.Type)
member.summary: Converts an assembly into an assembly name.
member.param: The configuration context.
The configuration culture.
The assembly to convert.
The destination type to which the assembly should be converted. (Ignored for configuration converters.)
member.returns: If is this conversion returns ; otherwise the return value will be the full name of the assembly.
member.exception: Thrown if is not and is not an .

member.name: T:Autofac.Configuration.Core.ConfigurationModule
member.summary: Base class for a configuration parsing/execution module.

remarks.para: Derived module classes are responsible for reading in configuration settings and populating the property. The value there will be used in to convert the configuration into container registrations.

member.summary: Executes the conversion of configuration data into component registrations.
member.param: The into which registrations will be placed.

remarks.para: This override uses the to convert the into component registrations in the provided .
If no specific is set, the default type will be used.

member.name: P:Autofac.Configuration.Core.ConfigurationModule.ConfigurationRegistrar
member.summary: Gets or sets the configuration registrar.
member.value: An that will be used as the strategy for converting the into component registrations. If this value is , the registrar will be a .

member.name: P:Autofac.Configuration.Core.ConfigurationModule.SectionHandler
member.summary: Gets the section handler.
member.value: The that will be converted into component registrations in a container.

member.name: T:Autofac.Configuration.ConfigurationRegistrar
member.summary: Default service for adding configured registrations to a container.

remarks.para: This default implementation of processes contents into registrations into a . You may derive and override to extend the functionality or you may implement your own .

member.name: T:Autofac.Configuration.IConfigurationRegistrar
member.summary: A service for adding configured registrations to a container.

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.IConfigurationRegistrar.RegisterConfigurationSection(Autofac.ContainerBuilder,Autofac.Configuration.SectionHandler)
member.summary: Registers the contents of a configuration section into a container builder.
member.param: The that should receive the configured registrations.
The containing the configured registrations.

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.ConfigurationRegistrar.RegisterConfigurationSection(Autofac.ContainerBuilder,Autofac.Configuration.SectionHandler)
member.summary: Registers the contents of a configuration section into a container builder.
member.param: The that should receive the configured registrations.
The containing the configured registrations.

remarks.para: This method is the primary entry point to configuration section registration. From here, the various modules, components, and referenced files get registered. You may override any of those behaviors for a custom registrar if you wish to extend registration behavior.

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.ConfigurationRegistrar.RegisterConfiguredComponents(Autofac.ContainerBuilder,Autofac.Configuration.SectionHandler)
member.summary: Registers individual configured components into a container builder.
member.param: The that should receive the configured registrations.
The containing the configured registrations.
member.exception: Thrown if there is any issue in parsing the component configuration into registrations.

remarks.para: This is where the individually configured component registrations get added to the . The collection from the get processed into individual registrations with associated lifetime scope, name, etc.
You may influence the process by overriding this whole method or by overriding these individual parsing subroutines:

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.ConfigurationRegistrar.RegisterConfiguredModules(Autofac.ContainerBuilder,Autofac.Configuration.SectionHandler)
member.summary: Registers individual configured modules into a container builder.
member.param: The that should receive the configured registrations.
The containing the configured registrations.
member.exception: Thrown if there is any issue in parsing the module configuration into registrations.

remarks.para: This is where the individually configured component registrations get added to the . The collection from the get processed into individual modules which are instantiated and activated inside the .

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.ConfigurationRegistrar.RegisterReferencedFiles(Autofac.ContainerBuilder,Autofac.Configuration.SectionHandler)
member.summary: Registers referenced configuration files into a container builder.
member.param: The that should receive the configured registrations.
The containing the configured registrations.
member.exception: Thrown if there is any issue in processing the referenced files into registrations.

remarks.para: This is where external files referenced in configuration get recursively loaded and added to the . The collection from the get processed into individual instances, each of which get registered with the .

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.ConfigurationRegistrar.SetInjectProperties``2(Autofac.Builder.IRegistrationBuilder{System.Object,``0,``1},System.String)
member.summary: Sets the property injection mode for the component.
member.param: The component registration on which property injection mode is being set.
The configuration value associated with property injection for this component registration.

remarks.para: By default, this implementation understands , empty, or values (false, 0, no) to mean "no property injection should occur" and values (true, 1, yes) to mean "property injection should occur."
You may override this method to extend the available grammar for property injection settings.

member.exception: Thrown if the value for is not part of the recognized grammar.

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.ConfigurationRegistrar.SetComponentOwnership``2(Autofac.Builder.IRegistrationBuilder{System.Object,``0,``1},System.String)
member.summary: Sets the ownership model for the component.
member.param: The component registration on which the ownership model is being set.
The configuration value associated with the ownership model for this component registration.

remarks.para: By default, this implementation understands or empty values to be "default ownership model"; lifetime-scope or LifetimeScope is "owned by lifetime scope"; and external or ExternallyOwned is "externally owned."
You may override this method to extend the available grammar for component ownership.

member.exception: Thrown if the value for is not part of the recognized grammar.

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.ConfigurationRegistrar.SetLifetimeScope``2(Autofac.Builder.IRegistrationBuilder{System.Object,``0,``1},System.String)
member.summary: Sets the lifetime scope for the component.
member.param: The component registration on which the lifetime scope is being set.
The configuration value associated with the lifetime scope for this component registration.

remarks.para: By default, this implementation understands or empty values to be "default ownership model"; single-instance or SingleInstance is singleton; instance-per-lifetime-scope, InstancePerLifetimeScope, per-lifetime-scope, or PerLifetimeScope is one instance per nested lifetime scope; and instance-per-dependency, InstancePerDependency, per-dependency, or PerDependency is one instance for each resolution call.
You may override this method to extend the available grammar for lifetime scope.

member.exception: Thrown if the value for is not part of the recognized grammar.

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.ConfigurationRegistrar.LoadType(System.String,System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Loads a type by name.
member.param: Name of the to load. This may be a partial type name or a fully-qualified type name.
The default to use in type resolution if is a partial type name.
member.returns: The resolved based on the specified name.
member.exception: Thrown if the specified can't be resolved as a fully-qualified type name and isn't a partial type name for a found in the .

member.name: T:Autofac.Configuration.ConfigurationSettingsReader
member.summary: Configures containers based upon app.config/web.config settings.

remarks.para: This module type uses standard .NET application configuration format files to initialize configuration settings. By default the standard app.config/web.config is used with a configuration section named autofac, but you can use the various constructors to override the file location or configuration section name.

If you are storing your configuration settings in a raw XML file (without the additional <configuration /> wrapper and section definitions you normally see in .NET application configuration) you can use the module to specify the XML file location directly.

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.ConfigurationSettingsReader.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the default application configuration file with a configuration section named autofac.

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.ConfigurationSettingsReader.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the default application configuration file and a named section.
member.param: The name of the configuration section corresponding to a .

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.ConfigurationSettingsReader.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a named configuration file and section.
member.param: The name of the configuration section corresponding to a .
The app.config/web.config format configuration file containing the named section.

member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Autofac.Configuration.ConfigurationSettingsReaderResources.ArgumentMayNotBeEmpty
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The {0} may not be empty..

member.name: P:Autofac.Configuration.ConfigurationSettingsReaderResources.ConfigurationFileNotFound
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Unable to find specified configuration file..

member.name: P:Autofac.Configuration.ConfigurationSettingsReaderResources.InitializeSectionHandler
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to You must initialize the section handler on the module before executing the load operation..

member.name: P:Autofac.Configuration.ConfigurationSettingsReaderResources.NoXmlInConfiguration
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to No XML content nodes found in configuration. Check the XML reader to ensure configuration is in place..

member.name: P:Autofac.Configuration.ConfigurationSettingsReaderResources.SectionNotFound
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The configuration section '{0}' could not be read..

member.name: P:Autofac.Configuration.ConfigurationSettingsReaderResources.ServiceTypeMustBeSpecified
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to If 'name' is specified, 'service' must also be specified (component name='{0}'.).

member.name: P:Autofac.Configuration.ConfigurationSettingsReaderResources.TypeConversionUnsupported
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Unable to convert object of type '{0}' to type '{1}'..

member.name: P:Autofac.Configuration.ConfigurationSettingsReaderResources.TypeNotFound
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The type '{0}' could not be found. It may require assembly qualification, e.g. "MyType, MyAssembly"..

member.name: P:Autofac.Configuration.ConfigurationSettingsReaderResources.UnrecognisedInjectProperties
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The value '{0}' is not valid for the inject-properties attribute. Valid values are 'yes' and 'no'..

member.name: P:Autofac.Configuration.ConfigurationSettingsReaderResources.UnrecognisedOwnership
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The value '{0}' is not valid for the ownership attribute. Valid values are 'lifetime-scope' (the default) and 'external'..

member.name: P:Autofac.Configuration.ConfigurationSettingsReaderResources.UnrecognisedScope
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The value '{0}' is not valid for the instance-scope attribute. Valid values are 'single-instance', 'per-dependency' (the default) and 'per-lifetime-scope'..

member.name: T:Autofac.Configuration.SectionHandler
member.summary: Section handler for Autofac configuration.

remarks.para: This configuration section is used for XML-based configuration of an Autofac container. While it is primarily used from inside app.config or web.config files, you may also use it with other arbitrary XML files via the helper method.

member.name: F:Autofac.Configuration.SectionHandler.DefaultSectionName
member.summary: The default section name that will be searched for.

member.summary: Deserializes a configuration section handler from a specific block of XML.
member.param: The used to read the XML configuration from the source.
member.returns: A read/parsed based on the contents of the .
member.exception: Thrown if does not contain XML configuration that can be parsed into a .

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.SectionHandler.Deserialize(System.String)
member.summary: Deserializes a configuration section handler from an XML configuration file.
member.param: The path to the configuration file to parse.
member.returns: A read/parsed based on the contents of the .
member.exception: Thrown if the file indicated by can't be found.
Thrown if the configuration can't properly be deserialized from the file.

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.SectionHandler.Deserialize(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Deserializes a configuration section handler from an XML configuration file.
member.param: The path to the configuration file to parse.
The name of the configuration section (if the is application configuration format); or to use the default configuration section name autofac or try the as a raw XML file.
member.returns: A read/parsed based on the contents of the .
member.exception: Thrown if the file indicated by can't be found.
Thrown if the configuration can't properly be deserialized from the file.

member.summary: Checks the validity of a configuration file path and converts relative paths to absolute.
member.param: The file path to check/normalize.
member.returns: If is an absolute path, it is returned unchanged; otherwise it is made absolute relative to the current configuration location.
member.exception: Thrown if the file indicated by can't be found.

member.name: T:Autofac.Configuration.XmlFileReader
member.summary: Configures containers based upon XML configuration settings that are not stored in .NET application configuration.

remarks.para: This module type uses raw XML files to initialize configuration settings. These files are expected to have XML in them that can be deserialized into a . This XML is the same format as you would see in a standard app.config/web.config for Autofac, but doesn't require the additional configuration section definition or other .NET application configuration XML around it.

If you are storing your configuration settings in a .NET application configuration file (app.config/web.config) you can use the module to read the settings right out of the configuration file without having to manually parse the XML.

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.XmlFileReader.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a specified XML configuration file.
member.param: The name of the configuration file containing XML that can deserialize into a .

remarks.para: Relative paths may be specified in relation to the current application folder (where you would normally find app.config or web.config).

member.name: T:Autofac.Configuration.Util.ReflectionExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for reflection-related types.

member.name: M:Autofac.Configuration.Util.ReflectionExtensions.TryGetDeclaringProperty(System.Reflection.ParameterInfo,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo@)
member.summary: Maps from a property-set-value parameter to the declaring property.
member.param: Parameter to the property setter.
The property info on which the setter is specified.
member.returns: True if the parameter is a property setter.
